perturbation.original_text: 6.1 Term. The initial term of this Agreement commences as of the Effective Date and, unless terminated earlier pursuant to any express provision of this Agreement, shall continue until five (5) years following the Effective Date (the "Initial Term"). Thereafter, this Agreement shall renew automatically for one (1) additional three (3) year period (the "Renewal Term" and collectively, together with the Initial Term, the "Term") unless either party provides the other with written notice of non-renewal at least ninety (90) days before the expiration of the Initial Term].
perturbation.changed_text: 6.1 Term. The initial term of this Agreement commences as of the Effective Date and, unless terminated earlier pursuant to any express provision of this Agreement, shall continue until five (5) years following the Effective Date (the "Initial Term"). Thereafter, this Agreement will not automatically renew and will expire, unless both parties agree in writing to renew the agreement for a term to be negotiated at that time. Any renewal shall be subject to mutual agreement and new terms.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the agreement auto-renews unless one party objects. The modified text states it will not auto-renew and requires a new written agreement. This creates a contradiction regarding the renewal process and introduces uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text:
11.3 Notices. All notices, requests, consents, claims, demands, waivers and other communications hereunder shall be in writing and addressed to the parties as follows (or as otherwise specified by a party in a notice given in accordance with this Section):

If to Licensor:
Room 303, 3rd Floor, St. George's Building, 2 Ice House Street, Central, Hong Kong
Facsimile: (852) 3526 0355
E-mail:angela@sg-cs.com
Attention: Angela Jen

If to Licensee:
100, 40 Lake Bellevue Dr,
Bellevue, WA, 98005
Facsimile: [FAX NUMBER]
E-mail: Peter@go-page.com
Attention: Peter Schulhof, President

Notices sent in accordance with this Section shall be deemed effectively given: (a) when received, if delivered by hand (with written
confirmation of receipt); (b) when received, if sent by a nationally recognized overnight courier (receipt requested); (c) on the date sent by facsimile or
e-mail (in each case, with confirmation of transmission), if sent during normal business hours of the recipient, and on the next business day, if sent
after normal business hours of the recipient; or (d) on the third business day after the date mailed, by certified or registered mail, return receipt
requested, postage prepaid.
perturbation.changed_text:
11.3 Notices. All notices, requests, consents, claims, demands, waivers and other communications hereunder shall be in writing and addressed to the parties as follows (or as otherwise specified by a party in a notice given in accordance with this Section):

If to Licensor:
Room 303, 3rd Floor, St. George's Building, 2 Ice House Street, Central, Hong Kong
Facsimile: (852) 3526 0355
E-mail:angela@sg-cs.com
Attention: Angela Jen

If to Licensee:
100, 40 Lake Bellevue Dr,
Bellevue, WA, 98005
Facsimile: [FAX NUMBER]
E-mail: Peter@go-page.com
Attention: Peter Schulhof, President

Notices sent in accordance with this Section shall be deemed effectively given: (a) when received, if delivered by hand (with written
confirmation of receipt); (b) only when confirmed by mail via return receipt requested. Facsimiles and emails are not effective notice under this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause accepts hand delivery, courier, fax, and email as effective forms of notice. The modified clause contradicts this by stating only mail with return receipt requested is effective. This could lead to disputes about whether proper notice was given if email or fax was used.

perturbation.original_text:
9.2 Cap on Monetary Damages. EACH PARTY’S LIABILITY ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT WILL NOT EXCEED AN
AMOUNT EQUAL TO THE AGGREGATE AMOUNTS PAID OR PAYABLE TO LICENSOR IN THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS PRECEDING THE
COMMENCEMENT OF THE CLAIM.
perturbation.changed_text:
9.2 Cap on Monetary Damages. EACH PARTY’S LIABILITY ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT WILL NOT EXCEED AN
AMOUNT EQUAL TO THE AGGREGATE AMOUNTS PAID OR PAYABLE TO LICENSOR IN THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS PRECEDING THE
COMMENCEMENT OF THE CLAIM. Notwithstanding this limitation, Licensee shall be fully liable for any damages arising from infringement of Licensor’s intellectual property.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause places a cap on damages. The added sentence removes the cap entirely in cases of IP infringement, effectively contradicting the general limitation. This makes it unclear whether a cap applies in those situations.
